newsitem.title: USA: Bando McGlocklin gets approval for holding company.
newsitem.headline: Bando McGlocklin gets approval for holding company.

text.p: Bando McGLocklin Capital Corp said the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago has approved its plan to form InvestorsBancorp Inc, a bank holding company.
In addition, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) has agreed to extend insurance coverage to depositors in the proposed InvestorsBank, the company said.

These actions are the last major approvals required to form the bank holding company and its operating subsidiary, InvestorsBank, the company said. The Wisconsin Department of Financial Institutions already has given preliminary approval to operate InvestorsBank under a state charter.
George Schonath, chairman and chief executive officer of Bando McGlocklin, also will serve as president of InvestorsBancorp. The bank plans to open the week of July 7.

On approval of the plan to spin off shares of InvestorsBancorp to shareholders of Bando McGlocklin by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission -- expected later this month -- it will announce the date for distribution of the bank holding company shares, it said.
Bando McGlocklin makes real estate loans to small businesses and has investments in manufacturing companies.
